inclusion.criterion: Group A subjects will be 8 women between 18 and 45 years of age who have complex partial seizures with Type 1 catamenial seizure exacerbation as previously defined.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients receiving antiepileptic drug therapy will continue on their medications.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: All subjects must agree to use double barrier contraceptives, have an intrauterine device in place or practice abstinence during the course of the study.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients will be recruited from the epilepsy patient population at the National Institutes of Health.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Any illness requiring chronic drug therapy other than antiepileptic drugs.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Use of tricyclic antidepressants within 4 weeks prior to randomization and/or anti-psychotic drugs within 2 weeks prior to randomization.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of epilepsy, CHF, depression. He is currently on Dilantin and phenobarbital. The patient's seizures are likely due to anoxic brain injury at birth.
